availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Gladish (Christian County, Kentucky, farmer, Juror)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and juror. Kentucky native. Married to Louisa J. Nichols Gladish in Todd County, Kentucky, on April 8, 1847. Father to Martha J. Gladish, James W. Gladish, William M. Gladish, and Columbus W. Gladish. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 50A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 480.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 738.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 294A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hamby, p. 370A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Todd County Marriages, Film #000367186, p. 64.
